      o /Norn <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norn_language>/

East
Scandinavian
	

  * *Swedish <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swedish_language>*
      o Åland <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C3%85land_Swedish>
      o Estonian <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Estonian_Swedish>
      o Finlandic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finland_Swedish>
      o Gotlandic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gotlandic>
      o Jamtlandic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jamtlandic_dialects>
      o Kalix <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kalix_dialect>
      o Kiruna <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kiruna_dialect>
      o Luleå <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lule%C3%A5_dialects>
      o Norrland <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norrland_dialects>
      o Ostrobothnian
        <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swedish_dialects_in_Ostrobothnia>
      o Småländska <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sm%C3%A5l%C3%A4ndska>
      o South Swedish
        <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Swedish_dialects>
          + Scanian <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scanian_dialect>
      o Stockholm <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stockholm_dialects>
      o Rinkeby <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rinkeby_Swedish>
      o Uppländska <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uppl%C3%A4ndska_dialect>
      o Västgötska <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C3%A4stg%C3%B6tska>
      o Westrobothnian <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Westrobothnian>
  * *Danish <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danish_language>*
      o Bornholmsk <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bornholmsk_dialect>
      o Gøtudanskt <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G%C3%B8tudanskt_accent>
      o Insular Danish <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Insular_Danish>
      o Jutlandic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jutlandic_dialect>
      o South Jutlandic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Jutlandic>
      o Perkerdansk <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perkerdansk>
  * Dalecarlian <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dalecarlian_dialects>

East
Germanic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Germanic_languages>
	

  * /Gothic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gothic_language>/
      o /Crimean Gothic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crimean_Gothic>/
  * /Burgundian <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burgundians>/
  * /Vandalic <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandalic>/

  * /Italics/ indicate extinct languages
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Language_death>
  * *Bold* indicates languages with more than 3 million speakers
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_languages_by_number_of_native_speakers>
  * Languages between parentheses are varieties
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variety_(linguistics)> of the
    language on their left.

Dictionaries of English

    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Middle_English_Dictionary>/

Historic 	

  * /Catholicon Anglicum
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Catholicon_Anglicum>/ (1483)
  * /The English Schoole-Master
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_English_Schoole-Master>/ (1596)
  * /The New World of English Words
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_New_World_of_English_Words>/ (1658)
  * /A New English Dictionary
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_New_English_Dictionary>/ (1702)
  * /An Universal Etymological English Dictionary
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/An_Universal_Etymological_English_Dictionary>/
    (1721)
  * /A Dictionary of the English Language
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A_Dictionary_of_the_English_Language>/ (1755)
  * /Webster's Dictionary
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Webster%27s_Dictionary>/ (1828)
  * Worcester's /Dictionary/
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joseph_Emerson_Worcester>
  * Richardson's /New Dictionary/
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Charles_Richardson_(lexicographer)>
  * /Imperial Dictionary
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Imperial_Dictionary_of_the_English_Language>/
    (1847–50)
  * /Century Dictionary
    <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Century_Dictionary>/ (1889–91)

    <https://dty.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E0%A4%85%E0%A4%99%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%9C%E0%A5%80_%E0%A4%AD%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B7%E0%A4%BE>
  * Kabɩyɛ
